messageBody:
maybe this can help try to subclass TestCase

import junit.framework.*;

public class YourTestCase extends TestCase {

public void runBare() throws Throwable {
super.runBare();
tearDownNoError();
}

// This teardown will run only if no error or failure occurs
protected void tearDownNoError() throws Exception {
}
}

Inherit your test from 'YourTestCase" and not from standard TestCase.
Extract parts from tearDown() to tearDownNoError() that you would like to run only
if no error or failure occurs in setup, test or teardown.

Jan
----- Original Message -----
From: jlindwall
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Wednesday, October 29, 2003 9:02 PM
Subject: [junit] Detecting failure in tearDown()


I'd like to be able to determine in tearDown() whether or not the
test succeeded (eg, success, fail, or error).

If you're curious why: If the test failed I'd like to leave the
database in it's current state to assist in manually determining what
went wrong. If the test succeeded I'd like to cleanu p the db.

Using the standard runner I don't see any way to do this. Do I have
to subclass the runners to add this feature?

Advice?

Thanks!
